messages.page_content:
- Topic: Street Name Change for Louisa Street
- Summary: The ordinance proposed changing the name of the portion of Louisa Street from Almonaster Avenue to Florida Avenue to Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue. It also included a recommendation to rename a section of Louisa Street between Florida Avenue and Chef Menteur Highway as Johnny Jackson Jr. Boulevard.
- Ordinance Number: 33555
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with amendments to rename a section of Louisa Street as Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue and Johnny Jackson Jr. Boulevard.
- Tags/Keywords: Street Name Change, Louisa Street, Johnny Jackson Jr., Renaming
- UID: 7cf2d779-de3e-47f9-9c4b-b17985d0f76d
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: DBE classification for formerly incarcerated individuals
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to provide regulations for a Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) classification for formerly incarcerated individuals, as per the requirements of M-22-95. The motion was amended and passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: SNC001-22
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was amended and passed.
- UID: 90111003-0c83-4224-a71a-991da8827988
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Motion M-22-95
- Summary: The amendment proposed by Councilmember Moreno aimed to direct the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465 of the Code of the City of New Orleans and expand and improve upon the City's existing Equitable Business Opportunities Program. The amendment passed with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95 - Amendment
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to Motion M-22-95 was approved, directing the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations and expand the City's existing Equitable Business Opportunities Program.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Equitable Business Opportunities Program, M-22-95, regulations
- UID: b46e3a15-36bf-4e0f-88a3-b484f72c9a64

- Topic: Motion (Lying Over) - No. M-22-95
- Summary: This motion aimed to direct the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465 of the Code of the City of New Orleans. It was referred to the Economic Development & Special Development Projects Committee, which recommended approval. The motion passed with no further amendments.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was approved, directing the Chief Administrative Office to develop required regulations.
- Tags/Keywords: Motion, regulations, M-22-95, Economic Development Committee
- UID: b46e3a15-36bf-4e0f-88a3-b484f72c9a64

- Topic: Conditional Use for Retail Sale of Packaged Alcoholic Beverages
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use permit for the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in a specific neighborhood business district. The ordinance was adopted.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Retail Sale, Alcoholic Beverages, Neighborhood Business District

- Topic: Zoning Change from Suburban Single-Family Residential to Suburban Multi-Family Residential
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to effect a zoning change from a suburban single-family residential district to a suburban multi-family residential district in a specific municipal district. The ordinance was adopted with a technical correction needed.
- Ordinance Number: 33,611
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with a technical correction needed.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Change, Residential District, Technical Correction

- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to Classify "Cemetery" as Permitted Use
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the comprehensive zoning ordinance to classify "cemetery" as a permitted use in a specific mixed-use district citywide. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,626
- Votes Summary:

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Zoning Change from BIP Business Industrial Park District to S-RS Single-Family Residential District
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to effect a zoning change in the ENORC Eastern New Orleans Renaissance Corridor. The change would reclassify the area from a Business Industrial Park District to a Single-Family Residential District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33626 - 28963 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The zoning change was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Business Industrial Park, Single-Family Residential, Eastern New Orleans Renaissance Corridor
- UID: b84316a9-1ccd-494e-af8d-ba253389721a

- Topic: Zoning Change from S-B1 Suburban Business District to S-RS Suburban Single-Family Residential District
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to effect a zoning change from a Suburban Business District to a Suburban Single-Family Residential District. It focused on a specific location in the Third Municipal District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33627 - 28964 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The zoning change was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Suburban Business District, Suburban Single-Family Residential, Third Municipal District
- UID: b84316a9-1ccd-494e-af8d-ba253389721a

- Topic: Request to Eliminate Cannabis Testing as Pre-Employment Screening Requirement
- Summary: The resolution requested the Civil Service Commission to evaluate and amend its rules to eliminate cannabis testing as a pre-employment screening requirement and as a basis for termination, unless there is clear evidence of impairment or intoxication. The resolution was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33628 - 28965 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was approved, requesting the amendment of rules related to cannabis testing.
- Tags/Keywords: Civil Service Commission, cannabis testing, pre-employment screening, resolution
- UID: b84316a9-1ccd-494e-af8d-ba253389721a

- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 110/21 - GOTHAM MARIGNY PROPERTIES, LLC
- Summary: Requesting a conditional use to permit a bar over 3,000 square feet in floor area in an HMC-1 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Commercial District and an RDO-1 Residential Diversity Overlay District. The City Planning Commission recommended "NO RECOMMENDATION".

- Topic: Solid Fence Requirement for Lots Abutting Residential Properties
- Summary: The ordinance requires the construction of a solid fence, made of wood or simulated wood, on lots that abut residential properties. This fence must be reflected on the landscape plan referenced in Proviso 5.

No. 33,527, an ordinance to establish minimum operational requirements for the New Orleans Police Department Crime Laboratory, including units accredited to test and analyze DNA, and to establish regular reporting requirements on sexual assault collection kits. - Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into Amendment No. 1 to a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the French Market Corporation, extending the term for an additional 3 years. - Topic: Revocation of Dedication to Public Use and Sale of Property
- Summary: This ordinance revokes the dedication to public use and authorizes the sale at public auction for a minimum price, of a portion of ground in the Third Municipal District of the City of New Orleans. The property is no longer needed for public purposes.

- Summary: This resolution states that the City shall equitably and fairly follow and enforce laws, recognizing and complying with state and federal law preempting the Home Rule Charter. messages.page_content:
- Topic: Conditional Use for Vocational Education Facility
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to permit a vocational education facility in specific commercial and overlay districts. The outcome of the vote was that the motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,641
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The conditional use for the vocational education facility was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Vocational Education, Conditional Use
- UID: 57eec21d-e603-4c17-92d2-7de201635211

- Topic: Rescission of Conditional Use for Day Care Center
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to grant the rescission of a previous conditional use permit for a day care center in a specific residential district, as the conditional use is now obsolete. The outcome of the vote was that the motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,642
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The rescission of the conditional use permit for the day care center was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Rescission, Day Care Center
- UID: 57eec21d-e603-4c17-92d2-7de201635211
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain several articles of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to create a new use category of "Boat Dock" for allowing boat rental facilities in specific water-adjacent zoning districts. The text amendment will affect properties within various zoning districts. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,643
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Boat Dock, Water-Adjacent, Ordinance
- UID: d5ccf7aa-7ec4-4ba2-a80f-79c9cc638cb7

- Topic: Conditional Use for Wine Shop
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to establish a conditional use to permit a wine shop in specific zoning districts. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,644
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Wine Shop, Zoning
- UID: d5ccf7aa-7ec4-4ba2-a80f-79c9cc638cb7

- Topic: Zoning Amendment for Specific District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain specific zoning regulations to establish a conditional use for a wine shop in designated zoning districts.
- Ordinance Number: 33,645
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote: Passed - (5 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Amendment, Wine Shop, Conditional Use
- UID: d5ccf7aa-7ec4-4ba2-a80f-79c9cc638cb7
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Waiver of fees and permit requirements for Louis Armstrong Park event
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to temporarily waive certain fees, permit fees, and requirements for the Save Our Souls Coalition community engagement event at Louis Armstrong Park. The duration and boundaries of the waiver were specified for the event on April 3, 2022. 
- Ordinance Number: 33645
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Fee waiver, Louis Armstrong Park, community event
- UID: cc6517ea-ee39-4df7-9201-458d4507283b

- Topic: Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
- Summary: The ordinance sought approval and authorization for the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Lease Agreement at Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport with STEVEN SALLINGER.
- Ordinance Number: 33646
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease Agreement, Louis Armstrong Airport
- UID: cc6517ea-ee39-4df7-9201-458d4507283b

- Topic: Redistricting of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to redistrict the City of New Orleans in accordance with the Home Rule Charter. 
- Ordinance Number: 33647
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Redistricting, New Orleans
- UID: cc6517ea-ee39-4df7-9201-458d4507283b

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for improving power generation
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City and Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans for the purpose of improving and maintaining power generation at the Carrollton Power Plant for the benefit of the city's infrastructure.
- Ordinance Number: 33648
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, power generation, infrastructure
- UID: cc6517ea-ee39-4df7-9201-458d4507283b
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Arts Council of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Arts Council of New Orleans to promote public art in the city. 
- Ordinance Number: 33648
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Arts Council, public art, promotion
- UID: bf50bdec-6b38-462f-a70e-0b3a4acf4c65

- Topic: Evaluation of Classified Pay Plan for DNA Analyst job series
- Summary: The ordinance requires the Department of City Civil Service to evaluate and provide recommendations for amending the Classified Pay Plan, specifically for the "DNA Analyst" job series, to align with current FBI standards and increase the minimum annual salary to market rate.
- Ordinance Number: 33649
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, DNA Analyst, job series, salary increase
- UID: bf50bdec-6b38-462f-a70e-0b3a4acf4c65

- Topic: Amendment of fees for property located in special security and improvement taxing districts
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend and reordain the fees for property located in special security and improvement taxing districts in the city, specifically for the Twinbrook Security District.
- Ordinance Number: 33650
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with amendments related to the approved fees for the Twinbrook Security District.
- Tags/Keywords: Fee amendment, security districts, Twinbrook Security District
- UID: bf50bdec-6b38-462f-a70e-0b3a4acf4c65
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Ad Valorem Taxes
- Summary: Councilmember Harris introduced an ordinance to amend and reordain a previous ordinance related to the levy of ad valorem taxes for the year 2022 and to reallocate the tax receipts for a state millage. The amendment also includes the addition of a special ad valorem tax for the New Orleans Public Library System. The ordinance was electronically submitted and is subject to a postponement deadline. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,652
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance is pending further action due to the postponement deadline. 
- Tags/Keywords: Ad Valorem Taxes, Amendment, New Orleans Public Library System
- UID: 21c9eb1c-e5b7-4ac3-86d7-9248cb57e060

- Topic: Franchise for Energy Transfer Geismar Oleins LLC
- Summary: Councilmember Morrell proposed an ordinance to repeal a previous ordinance and grant a non-exclusive franchise to Energy Transfer Geismar Oleins LLC for the construction, maintenance, and operation of an underground natural gas pipeline system. The ordinance also includes provisions for surety bond and annual payments. The ordinance was electronically submitted and is subject to a postponement deadline. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,653
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance is pending further action due to the postponement deadline. 
- Tags/Keywords: Franchise, Energy Transfer, Natural Gas Pipeline
- UID: 21c9eb1c-e5b7-4ac3-86d7-9248cb57e060

- Topic: Allocation of American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) Funds
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno introduced an ordinance to amend a previous ordinance and appropriate American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds provided to the City of New Orleans for gas utility assistance programs and initiatives aimed at reducing gas utility costs for residential gas customers. The ordinance was electronically submitted and is subject to a postponement deadline. 
- Ordinance Number: 33,654
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance is pending further action due to the postponement deadline. 
- Tags/Keywords: American Rescue Plan Act, ARPA Funds, Gas Utility Assistance
- UID: 21c9eb1c-e5b7-4ac3-86d7-9248cb57e060
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Gas Utility Assistance and Budget Appropriation
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds to support gas utility assistance programs and reduce gas utility costs for residential gas customers in New Orleans. 
- Ordinance Number: 33654
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed to allocate ARPA funds for gas utility assistance programs.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA funds, gas utility assistance, budget appropriation
- UID: d2e7b3e7-c8e4-42d0-be81-23091651b457

- Topic: Budget Appropriation and Council Review
- Summary: The ordinance aims to transfer appropriations from the City Planning Commission and the Department of Public Works to Miscellaneous Programs, effectively restricting budgeted appropriations to allow for Council review prior to expenditure of funds.
- Ordinance Number: 33655, 33656
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinances were passed to transfer appropriations and restrict budgeted funds for Council review.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget appropriation, Council review, appropriations transfer
- UID: d2e7b3e7-c8e4-42d0-be81-23091651b457
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 3-10-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Year 2022
- Summary: The ordinances aim to transfer appropriations from specific departments to Miscellaneous Programs in order to restrict budgeted appropriations for Council review prior to expenditure of funds.
- Ordinance Number: 33,658
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, allowing for the transfer of appropriations as proposed.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Amendment, Appropriations Transfer, Council Review
- UID: 7abebd89-1db0-4933-ab45-7a5b572cf5cb

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Year 2022
- Summary: The ordinances aim to transfer appropriations from the Department of Safety & Permits to Miscellaneous Programs in order to restrict budgeted appropriations for Council review prior to expenditure of funds.
- Ordinance Number: 33,659
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, allowing for the transfer of appropriations as proposed.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Amendment, Appropriations Transfer, Council Review
- UID: 7abebd89-1db0-4933-ab45-7a5b572cf5cb

- Topic: Motion for Adjournment
- Summary: A motion for adjournment was proposed and adopted at 2:20 PM.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion for adjournment was adopted, concluding the council meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Adjournment, Meeting Conclusion
- UID: 7abebd89-1db0-4933-ab45-7a5b572cf5cb
